fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Trade, Competition, Customs, Environment, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives: ESSA follows the work of DG Sante and the Directorate F, with a particular focus on the legislative package on sprout production enacted in 2013 (regulations 208/2013, 209/2013, 210/2013 and 211/2013). This is done with a view to ensure the good functioning of the EU market for sprouted seeds in compliance with EU legislation. ESSA is also active to ensure that production of seeds for sprouting in third countries becomes compliant with EU requirements.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: ESSA is a factual association linked to Freshfel AISBL
goals__remit:
ESSA is a trade association that represents the interest of European sprouted seeds growers. Its members are companies and associations established in Europe and involved in the production and/or trade of sprouted seeds as well as suppliers and service providers to the sprouted seeds sector. 
 
ESSA is working to promote the interests of European sprouted seed growers, to provide a forum to discuss issues affecting the European sprouted seeds sector and to provide an opportunity to discuss common issues such as food safety, EU regulatory affairs and other issues.
relevant_communication: ESSA in 2016 elaborated its hygiene guidelines for the production of sprouts and seeds for sprouting in order to ensure the correct application of the legislative package on sprout production enacted in 2013 (regulations 208/2013, 209/2013, 210/2013 and 211/2013), as well as other regulations. The link to the guideline document: http://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/HTML/?uri=CELEX:52017XX0708(01)&from=EN
legal_status: factual association linked to Freshfel AISBL
